messages.content: What is ComfyUI Word Cloud?
ComfyUI Word Cloud is a plugin for generating word cloud images in ComfyUI. It is an implementation of the word_cloud library on ComfyUI.
What are the main nodes available in the ComfyUI Word Cloud plugin?
The main nodes available in the ComfyUI Word Cloud plugin are Word Cloud, RGB Color Picker, and Load Text File.
How can users customize the font directory for the ComfyUI Word Cloud plugin?

Users can customize the font directory by editing the font_dir.ini file located in the root directory of the plugin. The directory path specified in this file will be used to collect *.ttf and *.otf font files.
What is the purpose of the 'mask_image' option in the Word Cloud node?

The 'mask_image' option in the Word Cloud node allows users to input an image that serves as the silhouette for the text shape in the generated word cloud. If the image has an alpha channel, it will be used as the contour.
How does the 'keynote_words' option in the Word Cloud node affect the generated word cloud?

The 'keynote_words' option in the Word Cloud node allows users to specify words that will be further enlarged in the generated word cloud, except for words that are also set in the 'stopwords' option.
What is the purpose of the RGB Color Picker node in the ComfyUI Word Cloud plugin?

The RGB Color Picker node in the ComfyUI Word Cloud plugin allows users to select colors from a color palette and output the corresponding RGB values in either hexadecimal (HEX) or decimal (DEC) format.
How can users load a text file for use with the ComfyUI Word Cloud plugin?
Users can load a text file using the Load Text File node, which allows specifying the path to a .txt file. The node will load the file using UTF-8 encoding and output the text content.
What is ComfyUI_WordCloud?
ComfyUI_WordCloud is a plugin for ComfyUI that generates word cloud images based on text content. It is an implementation of the word_cloud library in ComfyUI.
What new features have been added to the Word Cloud node in ComfyUI_WordCloud?
The Word Cloud node in ComfyUI_WordCloud has added a mask output and an RGB Color Picker node for more convenient color selection.
How can users define a custom font directory in ComfyUI_WordCloud?
Users can define a custom font directory by editing the font_dir.ini file in the root directory of the plugin. The default is the Windows system font directory (C:\Windows\fonts).
What is the purpose of the RGB Color Picker node in ComfyUI_WordCloud?
The RGB Color Picker node in ComfyUI_WordCloud allows users to select colors from a color panel and output the RGB values in either hexadecimal (HEX) or decimal (DEC) format.
What is the function of the Load Text File node in ComfyUI_WordCloud?
The Load Text File node in ComfyUI_WordCloud loads a text file from a specified path using UTF-8 encoding and outputs the content as a string.
How can users install the ComfyUI_WordCloud plugin?

Users can install the ComfyUI_WordCloud plugin by cloning the repository into the ComfyUI custom_nodes directory using the command 'git clone https://github.com/chflame163/ComfyUI_WordCloud.git' or by downloading and extracting the zip file into the same directory. Additionally, users need to install the dependencies by running the command '..\..\..\python_embeded\python.exe -m pip install -r requirements.txt' in the ComfyUI_WordCloud directory.
What is the default font used in ComfyUI_WordCloud if the custom font directory is invalid?

If the custom font directory is invalid, ComfyUI_WordCloud will use the default font directory, which contains the Alibaba-PuHuiTi-Heavy.ttf file licensed by Alibaba Group Holding Limited, allowing free use by any individual or business.
